summary.department: Department of Mathematics and Computer Science
research_focus: Digital Health and Social Care Systems

responsibilities.main_research: Conduct research with business partners in AI-based systems for digital health focusing on impact and risk assessments.
responsibilities.teaching: Contribute to teaching activities up to 20% of working time.

summary.collaboration: The project OPEHRA includes collaboration with professionals in the industry and public sector.

eligibility.degree: PhD in Computer Science or closely related field
eligibility.completion_timeframe: PhD must have been completed no more than three years before the application deadline.

submission_guidelines: CV including relevant experience and knowledge
Cover letter (maximum 2 pages) describing qualifications and research interests
List of publications with specified roles
Copy of PhD degree or expected completion date
Copy of doctoral thesis and relevant publications
Two references, at least one being a supervisor

summary.description: The project focuses on integrating human rights in the software engineering lifecycle for digital health, with an emphasis on ethics, fairness, privacy, and data protection.
program_highlights: Interdisciplinary research team from computer science, gender studies, and health
Focus on ethical aspects, impact, and risk mitigation in AI systems

experience: Scientific experience in impact and risk assessments related to digital health systems
Interdisciplinary research experience including AI, cybersecurity, and relevant legal frameworks
qualifications: Familiarity with European legal frameworks (AI Act, GDPR)

summary.equality_commitment: Gender equality, diversity, and democratic approach form the foundation of the university.
summary.community_invitation: Strong commitment to community collaboration and knowledge exchange.
summary.academic_reputation: Awarded the European Commission’s HR Excellence in Research.
